description: This course invites students to engage the garden as a starting point for creative research and artistic production. In cities, gardens provide one of the most intimate experiences many people have with more-than-human ecologies sometimes known as “nature.”  We will take a multi-sensory and multi-media approach, experimenting with drawing, photography, and multimedia projects as ways to observe, represent, and imagine the ways humans relate to the rest of life in an age of environmental urgency. Readings, discussion, and artistic critique will also play an integral part of our collective investigation as students cultivate a body of work at semester’s end.
title: Culturing Nature: Ecological Art and the Garden
prerequisite:
All Year 1 Common Curriculum modules and YHU2291 Intro to the Arts; or with the permission of the instructor for other students of broad backgrounds.

Training in basic (observational) drawing is preferred. A portfolio review of previous works will be necessary for all students. Entrance to this module requires submission of an art portfolio of 10 images along with captions, and a brief statement of interest. This portfolio may contain artworks of any media that show your motivation for enrolling in this module.
